06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:40): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: was it intended that canvas.getContext() cache a null return value from "Return a new object for contextId"? or was it assumed that it would never fail if the context is supported by the UA?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:42): (guessing it wasn't intended to receive null as a return value, since null usually isn't considered "a new object")
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:42): looks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:43): it can't cache null
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (04:43): as you say, null is not a new object :-)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:44): (and firefox just crashed, so a minute of thrashing to restart it...)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:44): should the abstract "return a new object" algorithm never return null?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:45): getContext just doesn't seem to describe what happens on error--it seems like the "primary context" should also not be set on error
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:49): (webgl returns null on error, which is why I care--it doesn't seem like that's valid)
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (04:50): the problem is for webgl context creation should be async
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (04:50): since it's heavyweight and can fail
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (04:50): 2d context creation is assumed to be pretty lightweight and won't reasonably fail
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:51): they do have "context lost"/"context restored" events, but they're used later
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:52): i'm trying to convince them to do something saner, but that's hard to do when I can't tell what getContext actually wants them to do :)

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:53): IMO: getContext should propagate exceptions from context creation, clear the "primary context" on exception if it was just set, and prohibit null as a return value entirely
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (04:54): what would you return in the case of a context initialization failure?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:54): nothing--throw an exception
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:55): it's a synchronous failure
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (04:55): so you'd have to block the call until you knew the context was ready
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:55): but I can't recommend that to webgl when getContext itself doesn't support it
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:55): it already has to do that
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:56): since webgl returns null if the context can't be created; now it would just throw an exception instead
353fa4cc248867e98de9cab7d122c320 (04:56): right. which is unfortunate for webgl but orthogonal to your concern
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:56): from talking with them this isn't totally set in stone, which is why I'm trying to nudge this towards something better before it is
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (04:57): (which is why I'm nagging hixie on IRC :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:15): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: the abstract "return a new object" algorithm should never return null, it should return a new object. :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:15): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: how can there be an error?
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:16): webgl context creation can fail; it doesn't know if it can create a context until you try
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:16): why can it fail?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:16): i don't understand how it could possibly fail
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:17): you just get an object back
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:17): what is there to fail
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:17): creating the context creates the OS OpenGL context; that may fail
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (05:17): (or other 3d library)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:17): that's the UAs problem, it shouldn't expose such failures to web code
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:17): web pages aren't going to be able to do any thing useful if getContext() returns null
